intro: Trukia tahitiensis, commonly known as the Tahitian trukia, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Trukia tahitiensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the local flora of the region.
